revised_title: Description and Anatomy of the Double-Horned Rhinoceros of Sumatra
tldr: The author, William Bell, provides a detailed description and analysis of the physical characteristics and anatomy of the double-horned rhinoceros of Sumatra. He compares and contrasts the features of this species with the single-horned rhinoceros, highlighting differences in their horns, skin, and overall appearance. Bell also discusses the reproductive and skeletal structures of the double-horned rhinoceros, offering insights into its unique biology.
